project.title: PAGI Asterisk Gateway Interface PHP Client

docblock.description: This is our "dispatcher", you should invoke this one from your dialplan.
docblock.long-description:
This script will assume the existance of the following environment variables: -- PAGIApplication: Name of the class that extends PAGIApplication that you want to run. -- PAGIBootstrap: Name of the file (like a.php) that you want to include_once before running the application. -- log4php: Absolute full path to the log4php.properties (may be a dummy path, in this case you may gain some performance but wont be able to see any logs apart from the asterisk console).

PHP Version 5

docblock.description: log4php logger or our own dummy.
Called when PHPvm is shutting down.
Called to run the application, after calling init().
Your error handler. Be careful when implementing this one.
Your signal handler. Be careful when implementing this one.
Constructor. Will call set_error_handler() and pcntl_signal() to setup your errorHandler() and signalHandler(). Also will call register_shutdown_function() to register your shutdown() function.
Facade to access asterisk logger (see logger.conf in your asterisk installation).

parse_markers.error: The type hint of the argument is incorrect for the type definition of the @param tag with argument $options in exec()
The type hint of the argument is incorrect for the type definition of the @param tag with argument $options in dial()
The type hint of the argument is incorrect for the type definition of the @param tag with argument $frequencies in playCustomTones()

docblock.description: Returns an instance of ChannelVariables to access agi variables.
Logs to asterisk console. Uses agi command "VERBOSE".
Logs to asterisk logger. Uses application LOG.

tag.name: param
tag.description: One of ERROR, WARNING, NOTICE, DEBUG, VERBOSE, DTMF

docblock.description: Retrieves channel status. Uses agi command "CHANNEL STATUS"
Plays a file, can be interrupted by escapeDigits.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Waits up to <timeout> milliseconds for channel to receive a DTMF digit.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Milliseconds to wait. -1 to block indefinitely.

docblock.description: Reads input from user. Uses agi command "GET DATA".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Maximum time between digits before timeout.

docblock.description: Reads input from user. Uses agi command "GET OPTION".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Maximum time between digits before timeout.

docblock.description: Says digits. Uses agi command "SAY DIGITS".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Says a number. Uses agi command "SAY NUMBER".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Says time. Uses agi command "SAY TIME".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Say a given date and time, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Uses agi command "SAY DATETIME".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format the time should be said in.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Say a given date, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Uses agi command "SAY DATE".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Say a given character string with phonetics, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Say a given character string, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Uses agi command "SAY PHONETIC".

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Changes the priority for continuation upon exiting the application.
Changes the extension for continuation upon exiting the application.
Changes the context for continuation upon exiting the application.
Changes the callerid of the current channel. Uses agi command "SET CALLERID"
Enables/Disables the music on hold generator. Uses agi command "SET MUSIC".

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to enable, false to disable.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If <class> is not specified then the default music on hold class will be used.

docblock.description: Answers the current channel. Uses agi command "ANSWER".
Hangups the current channel. Uses agi command "HANGUP".
Returns a variable value. Uses agi command "GET VARIABLE". False if variable is not set.
Returns a variable value. Uses agi command "GET FULL VARIABLE". False if variable is not set.
Sets a variable. Uses agi command "SET VARIABLE".
Executes an application. Uses agi command "EXEC".
Sends the given text on a channel. Uses agi command "SEND TEXT".
Sends the given image on a channel. Uses agi command "SEND IMAGE".
Cause the channel to automatically hangup at <time> seconds in the future.
docblock.long-description: Of course it can be hungup before then as well. Setting to 0 will cause the autohangup feature to be disabled on this channel. Uses agi command "SET AUTOHANGUP".

docblock.description: Deletes an entry in the Asterisk database for a given family and key.
Deletes a family or specific keytree withing a family in the Asterisk database.
Retrieves an entry in the Asterisk database for a given family and key.
Adds or updates an entry in the Asterisk database for a given family, key, and value.
Record to a file until <escape digits> are received as dtmf.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Target file, without the .wav (or extension chosen).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional sequence of digits that can be used to skip the sound.

docblock.description: Tries to dial the given channel.
Indicates progress of a call, starting early audio.
Indicates busy and waits for hangup. Does not play a busy tone.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Time in seconds to wait for hangup

docblock.description: Indicates congestion and waits for hangup. Does not play a busy tone.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Time in seconds to wait for hangup

docblock.description: Plays a tone defined in indications.conf.

tag.name: link
tag.description: 2011 Marcelo Gornstein <marcelog@gmail.com> Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. docblock.description: Initial channel variables given by asterisk at start.
Initial arguments given by the user in the dialplan.
Sends a command to asterisk. Returns an array with: [0] => AGI Result (3 digits) [1] => Command result [2] => Result data.
Opens connection to agi. Will also read initial channel variables given by asterisk when launching the agi.
Returns a result object given a string (the agi result after executing a command).
Returns true if the current line marks the end of the environment variables.
Will read and save an environment variable as either a variable or an argument.
This class decorates a read result with a play operation like stream file, say digits, etc.

docblock.description: This decorated result adds the functionality to check for a dial result.
Returns total time for the call in seconds.
Returns true if the result was BUSY.
Returns true if the result was CONGESTION.
Returns true if the result was CANCEL.
Returns true if the result was ANSWER.
Returns true if the result was NOANSWER.
Returns true if the result was CHANUNAVAIL.
Returns features available for the call.

docblock.description: This decorated result adds the functionality to check for user input. We need a distinction between a single digit read (this class) and a data read (DataReadResult) because asterisk sends the ascii number for the character read (the first case) and the literal string in the latter.

docblock.description: Sends a command to asterisk. Returns an array with: [0] => AGI Result (3 digits) [1] => Command result [2] => Result data.
Opens connection to agi. Will also read initial channel variables given by asterisk when launching the agi.
Returns a client instance for this call.

docblock.long-description:
Note: The client accepts an array with options. The available options are

log4php.properties => Optional. If set, should contain the absolute path to the log4php.properties file.

stdin => Optional. If set, should contain an already open stream from where the client will read data (useful to make it interact with fastagi servers or even text files to mock stuff when testing). If not set, stdin will be used by the client.

stdout => Optional. Same as stdin but for the output of the client.

docblock.description: CDR facade. Use this to access cdr variables.
The channels uses specified field (read-write). CDR(userfield).
Total answered time for the call in seconds. CDR(billsec).
Total length of the call in seconds. CDR(duration).
Time the call was answered. CDR(answer).
Returns a custom field in the cdr. CDR(name)
Sets a custom field in the cdr. CDR(name).

docblock.long-description:
If the channel has a cdr, that cdr record has it's own set of variables which can be accessed just like channel variables. The following builtin variables are available and, unless specified, read-only.

${CDR(clid)} Caller ID ${CDR(src)} Source ${CDR(dst)} Destination ${CDR(dcontext)} Destination context ${CDR(channel)} Channel name ${CDR(dstchannel)} Destination channel ${CDR(lastapp)} Last app executed ${CDR(lastdata)} Last app's arguments ${CDR(start)} Time the call started. ${CDR(answer)} Time the call was answered. ${CDR(end)} Time the call ended. ${CDR(duration)} Duration of the call. ${CDR(billsec)} Duration of the call once it was answered. ${CDR(disposition)} ANSWERED, NO ANSWER, BUSY ${CDR(amaflags)} DOCUMENTATION, BILL, IGNORE etc ${CDR(accountcode)} The channel's account code (read-write). ${CDR(uniqueid)} The channel's unique id. ${CDR(userfield)} The channels uses specified field (read-write).

In addition, you can set your own extra variables with a traditional Set(CDR(var)=val) to anything you want.

NOTE Some CDR values (eg: duration & billsec) can't be accessed until the call has terminated. As of 91617, those values will be calculated on-demand if requested. Until that makes it into a stable release, you can set endbeforehexten=yes in cdr.conf, and then use the "hangup" context to wrap up your call.

PHP Version 5

docblock.long-description:
If the channel has a cdr, that cdr record has it's own set of variables which can be accessed just like channel variables. The following builtin variables are available and, unless specified, read-only.

${CDR(clid)} Caller ID ${CDR(src)} Source ${CDR(dst)} Destination ${CDR(dcontext)} Destination context ${CDR(channel)} Channel name ${CDR(dstchannel)} Destination channel ${CDR(lastapp)} Last app executed ${CDR(lastdata)} Last app's arguments ${CDR(start)} Time the call started. ${CDR(answer)} Time the call was answered. ${CDR(end)} Time the call ended. ${CDR(duration)} Duration of the call. ${CDR(billsec)} Duration of the call once it was answered. ${CDR(disposition)} ANSWERED, NO ANSWER, BUSY ${CDR(amaflags)} DOCUMENTATION, BILL, IGNORE etc ${CDR(accountcode)} The channel's account code (read-write). ${CDR(uniqueid)} The channel's unique id. ${CDR(userfield)} The channels uses specified field (read-write).

In addition, you can set your own extra variables with a traditional Set(CDR(var)=val) to anything you want.

NOTE Some CDR values (eg: duration & billsec) can't be accessed until the call has terminated. As of 91617, those values will be calculated on-demand if requested. Until that makes it into a stable release, you can set endbeforehexten=yes in cdr.conf, and then use the "hangup" context to wrap up your call.

PHP Version 5

docblock.description: Returns the value for the given parameter.
Sets a given parameter with the given value.
Returns the value for the given variable.
Sets a given variable with the given value.
Returns channel to use for the call.
Returns Caller ID, Please note: It may not work if you do not respect the format: CallerID: "Some Name" <1234>
Sets the Caller ID, Please note: It may not work if you do not respect the format: CallerID: "Some Name" <1234>
Returns seconds to wait for an answer. Default is 45.
Sets seconds to wait for an answer. Default is 45.
Returns number of retries before failing (not including the initial attempt, e.g. 0 = total of 1 attempt to make the call). Default is 0.
Sets number of retries before failing (not including the initial attempt, e.g. 0 = total of 1 attempt to make the call). Default is 0.
Returns seconds between retries, Don't hammer an unavailable phone.
Sets seconds between retries, Don't hammer an unavailable phone.
Returns account code to use for this call.
Sets account code to use for this call.
Returns context to use for this call when answered.
Sets context to use for this call when answered.
Returns priority to use for this call when answered.
Sets priority to use for this call when answered.
Returns extension to use for this call when answered.
Sets extension to use for this call when answered.
Returns Asterisk Application to run (use instead of specifiying context, extension and priority)
Sets Asterisk Application to run (use instead of specifiying context, extension and priority)
Returns the options to be passed to application.
Sets the options to be passed to application.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Options to set. No keys, just plain values.

docblock.description: If the file's modification time is in the future, the call file will not be deleted
If the file's modification time is in the future, the call file will not be deleted
Sets if should move to subdir "outgoing_done" with "Status: value", where value can be Completed, Expired or Failed.
Sets if should move to subdir "outgoing_done" with "Status: value", where value can be Completed, Expired or Failed.
Returns the text describing this call file, ready to be spooled.
Deconstructs a call file from the given text.
